content.description: as all the routes in the back forty this is a face climb with lots of little edges and crimps. crux at bottom.
content.location: left most route on the back forty

content.description: As with most of the routes on the Back 40, Slightly Toasted Cracker offers high quality technical climbing thats sure to please.  Not sure about the grade in the new 2011 guide though, this route felt about as hard as I just Do Eyes.
content.protection: 10 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Next route to the right of Crazy Wynona.

content.description: Moderate climbing to crux pulling on a mono (yes mono on a 5.10).
Follow a light colored streak up the face on perfect rock. Every move on this climb is super fun and it stays on you the entire way without ever getting very difficult. Do it to see what I mean!
content.location: Third from Left.  Between Hell Yes.. .11c and Crazy Wynona .11d.

climbs.name: Hell Yes I want Cheesy Poofs

content.description:
Another brilliant Charlie Kardaleff line!!!

3 bolts up through a budge,  then straight up the head wall on crimps and pockets to an 11 crux up high on the route.  This along with the other Back Forty routes are all outstanding and worth the short hike to the back side of the FCR.
content.protection: 11 Bolts to a bolted rap anchor
content.location: Between Psychadelic Milk Painter .11a and I Just Do Eyes .11b.

content.description: Balsy to add another even longer vert endurofest when there were already 3 other awesome ladders of pockets and edges on the wall, but CK produced yet another classic, maybe the best on the wall.  (Now another to the right too!!)
content.location: The fourth route from the left, between I Just Do Eyes and Slightly Toasted Cracker.
